thread.title: Schulz Says He Won’t Enter German Coalition Government

author: Zeke Turner
title: Schulz Says He Won’t Enter German Coalition Government
text:
BERLIN—The chairman of Germany’s center-left Social Democrats said Friday he would no longer enter the next coalition cabinet as he tried to contain a backlash that threatens to derail Angela Merkel’s plans for a fourth term.
Martin Schulz was attempting to placate mounting anger in the center-left SPD about his leadership and boost the likelihood that the party’s roughly 470,000 members would endorse the alliance struck this week with Ms. Merkel’s conservatives. A “no” vote would mean Germany would almost certainly face... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
